structure.unit: CLASSIFICATION AND DESIGNATION OF OFFENSES -- AUTHORIZED DISPOSITION

text.section: An adult, or a minor under eighteen (18) years of age who may be tried as an adult, convicted of a crime and subject to sentencing, is referred to in KRS 532.135 and 532.140 as a defendant.

A defendant with significant subaverage intellectual functioning existing concurrently with substantial deficits in adaptive behavior and manifested during the developmental period is referred to in KRS 532.135 and 532.140 as a defendant with a serious intellectual disability. "Significantly subaverage general intellectual functioning" is defined as an intelligence quotient (I.Q.) of seventy (70) or below.

law.history: Amended 2012 Ky. Acts ch. 146, sec. 133, effective July 12, 2012. -- Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 488, sec. 1, effective July 13, 1990.
